description: Replacement of an existing InLink unit, with a Street Hub 3 unit including illuminated advertisement display.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

1. No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

2. No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to

(a)endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military);
(b)obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air; or
(c)hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.

3. Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site.

4. Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.

5. Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<ol><li style="text-align: left;">Illumination for the proposed sign must remain below the limit set out in the Institute of Lighting Professionals (ILP) publication: The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements including digital displays (PLG05/23, 2023).</li><li style="text-align: left;">For daytime lighting, either no illumination should be used, or maximum lighting levels (such as for digital displays) must be in accordance with nighttime maximums or otherwise controlled to comply with the guidance approach to ambient lighting. If not already proposed in the application, this should be secured by condition.</li><li style="text-align: left;">The minimum display time for each advertisement shall be 10 seconds. The use of message sequencing for the same product is prohibited, and advertisements must not include features or equipment that would allow interactive messages or advertisements to be displayed.</li><li style="text-align: left;">There shall be no special effects (including noise, smell, smoke, animation, exposed cold cathode tubing, flashing, scrolling, three-dimensional, intermittent, or video elements) of any kind during the time that any message is displayed, in the interest of highway safety.</li></ol>
